Article.ArticleTitle: Amyotrophic lateral sclerosis: Nursing care and considerations.

Abstract.AbstractText: Amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS) is a rapidly progressive neurodegenerative disease that is always fatal, although treatment can help slow disease progression. This article discusses the etiology and pathophysiology, signs and symptoms, diagnosis, and clinical management of ALS, with special nursing considerations to help patients at the end of life.
